paper_abstract: A method of frame synchronization between the color video and depth-map video for depth based 3D video using edge coherence is proposed. We find a synchronized pair of frames using edge coherence by computing the maximum number of overlapped edge pixels between the color video and depth-map video in regions of temporal frame difference. The experimental results show that the proposed method can be used for synchronization of depth-based 3D video and that it is robust against Gaussian noise with sigma = less than 30 and video compression by H.264/AVC with QP = less than 44.
paper_title: Frame Synchronization for Depth-Based 3D Video Using Edge Coherence
